intro: Kadua coriacea, commonly known as the rough kadua, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically rough to the touch, giving it its common name. Kadua coriacea is often found in coastal habitats and is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native environment.
